article_text:
“Sometimes, patience really does pay off,” National Journal declares in one of the most banal lead sentences ever. “The Obama administration claimed a victory Wednesday on the Iran deal, clinching the last vote of the 34 senators needed to allow the accord to survive”—that of Sen. Barbara Mikulski of Maryland, who’s retiring after next year. The magazine attributes the Obama victory to “the White House’s focus on the long game in a sustained, grueling effort.”

So does the New York Times—but not in the first paragraph....

article_summary:
The magazine attributes the Obama victory to “the White House’s focus on the long game in a sustained, grueling effort.”So does the New York Times—but not in the first paragraph....
“Sometimes, patience really does pay off,” National Journal declares in one of the most banal lead sentences ever.
“The Obama administration claimed a victory Wednesday on the Iran deal, clinching the last vote of the 34 senators needed to allow the accord to survive”—that of Sen. Barbara Mikulski of Maryland, who’s retiring after next year.
